intro: Suteria hookeriana, commonly known as Hooker's suteria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high elevations. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in the summer months, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Suteria hookeriana is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh climatic conditions.
